column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=DS : Would you agree with the idea that children do n't grow up reading much anymore , outside of what 's required ?
#Text=GT : I think they do .
#Text=There 's always been a number of young people who are in the category of being readers and the majority are not .
#Text=And that was true when I was a child and when my wife was a child .
#Text=My wife has now been a professional reader and editor for fifty years .
#Text=But there were those who were drawn to reading and those who were not , found it boring or were more outward than internalized in their nature .
#Text=Many of the people I know , who are very successful and read a lot , are people who experienced illness or injury when they were young .
#Text=They grew up with books because they could not interact at a young age with their contemporaries .
#Text=Off the top of my head , Frances Ford Coppollo , people I know , Scorsese , Lee Iacocca ...
#Text=Or many people who have had to sit when they were eleven or six or five .
#Text=They had to stay in bed , they were drawn to books and the books became their action .
#Text=The books became their activity .
#Text=They vicariously lived through the work of writers or maybe they lived through music , maybe they lived through something else .

#Text=But that idea of being kept apart from the drive to be popular , the drive to be part of a clique that seemed to be in favor , when you are isolated , then maybe you are drawn out of your isolation by what you read and get a larger sense of the world .
#Text=DS : You 're saying that there never was really a time when people read more unless they had cause to read a lot based upon their circumstances ?
#Text=GT : Well I 'll talk about what I really know , which is what I have personally experienced .
#Text=I grew up in a home with very few books .
#Text=There was one book , and I had no idea how my father got it .
#Text=Maybe someone gave it to him . Short stories by the French writer Guy de Maupassant .
#Text=I read those stories , all of them , twice probably , when I was ten .
#Text=Later on , when I was in high school , 12 , 13 , 14 , 15 , I was reading fiction .
#Text=The fiction I was reading , and I wrote about this in my last book , was Frank Yerby .
#Text=People have never heard of him ; he 's not in any canon .
#Text=Frank Yerby was a black man , who lived in Spain and wrote these romance novels .
#Text=And there must have been seven or eight or nine of them .
#Text=They sold very well .
#Text=A few of them were made into movies I never saw .
#Text=I loved those stories because they were richly described .
#Text=The characters were very very detailed .
#Text=Very precise detail .
#Text=And that shaped my life .
#Text=I was a writer who does very much insist on and has affection for detail .
